description:
The use of Computer Aided Design (CAD) software is an essential maker skill. CAD designs are required to make things with 3D printers and CNC machines; however, it can be useful when planning any project. If you have just gotten your sign off on the 3D printers or other CNC machines, this is a great place to start.

This is an opportunity to obtain CAD project guidance, instruction on the use of CAD software, and help with the design and manufacture of your projects. Come with questions, 3D models, or ideas.

Software: Autodesk Fusion 360, Autodesk inventor, Onshape, Autodesk 3ds Max, Autodesk Maya, Blender, Zbrush, Sculptris, Unity Game Engine, V Carve, and RDWorks (laser cutter software).
name: CAD and 3D Modeling Help and Instruction

description:
In 2018, Vodafone sponsored a world champion drone racing pilot. They made a huge splash when they set the world speed record for a VTOL, tilt motor aircraft. They used a fixed-wing aircraft with tilt motors to achieve a speed of 149 MPH. This is now the official time to beat with the Guinness Book Of World Records.

The design that was used for the world record was not purpose built and had a lot of compromises. These compromises leave a lot of opportunity for improvement so I think breaking the record is very achievable for a group of makers.

Join us in creating a Nova Labs team to design, fabricate and fly a drone that will beat the existing world record and become certified by Guinness! Nova Labs gives us access to some amazing equipment such as laser cutters, CNC and CAD which lend themselves perfectly to this type of challenge. The team is free to join and open to makers of all backgrounds and experience levels. We will meeting weekly to design, fabricate and test our drone so that we can become the new world speed record holders!!
name: Drone World Speed Record Build Team

description:
Come out and join us for this awesome project class where you will make your very own kitchen knife! This is day 2. Please sign up for Day one here: https://www.meetup.com/NOVA-Makers/events/258521498/

Handcrafted knives are a great way to impress your friends at holiday parties and make a great gift that will be cherished for a lifetime.
This is a multi-day class where you will learn the everything you need to know to make gorgeous, high-performance knives including:

- Selecting or creating the appropriate design
- Metal selection
- Handle materials
- Grinding techniques
- Heat treating (classroom only due to time constraints)

You will be provided with a piece of rough shaped, heat treated and pre-drilled steel, your choice of handle materials and all other supplies and instructions you need to make your own 4 to 5 inch (blade length) paring knife (9 inches overall length). The steel will be oversized so that you can create something unique that appeals to you or whoever you are making it for.

The class will be a combination of classroom instruction, hands-on practice, and coaching. You will be expected to work on your knife between class sessions to ensure it is ready for the next steps.

Prerequisites:
- 72” belt grinder signoff
- Metal yellow
- Wood lathe (Recommended but not required)

Safety: Must wear non-synthetic shoes and clothing or you will not be able to participate in grinding.

All tools and materials provided as part of the class including:
Steel - Nitro V
Kirinite - 1/4 inch (3 colors to choose from)
Liner (5 colors to choose from)
80 grit belt (Blaze)
120 grit belt- Stiff (Blaze)
Phoenix JA512 - 120
Phoenix JA512 - 220
Phoenix JA512 - 400
Norax belts though 5x/1300 grit (to share as class)
Sheet of 400 grit sandpaper
Sheet of 800 grit sandpaper
Sheet of 1000 grit sandpaper
Sheet of 1500 grit sandpaper
Sheet of 2000 grit sandpaper
Pins
Glue
Gloves
Glue stick
Cardboard
Glue cup
name: BL: Make Your Own Kitchen Knife Day 2 of 2
